thread.section_title: CONFIRMED: Man City v Man Utd rearranged for a Thursday amid fixture chaos – Metro
thread.title: CONFIRMED: Man City v Man Utd rearranged for a Thursday amid fixture chaos
thread.title_full: CONFIRMED: Man City v Man Utd rearranged for a Thursday amid fixture chaos

author: Simon Rice
title: CONFIRMED: Man City v Man Utd rearranged for a Thursday amid fixture chaos
text:
The match will be played on a Thursday (Getty) The Manchester derby at the Etihad Stadium has been rearranged for a Thursday evening, the Premier League has confirmed.
Man City will host Manchester United on April 27 after the original fixture was delayed due to United’s participation in the EFL Cup final.
David Luiz provides major update on three-month knee injury The decision comes amid Jose Mourinho’s persistent complaints about his side’s fixture congestion.
Both teams will be playing on the Sunday prior – Man City against Arsenal in the FA Cup at 3pm and Manchester United away at Burnley at 2.15pm.
While City have a quick turnaround afterwards with a trip to Middlesbrough on the Saturday at 3pm, Manchester United have an additional day, playing Swansea at Old Trafford on Sunday at 12pm.
Rearranged Manchester derby will take place on Thursday 27 April
Five more #PL fixtures have also been rescheduled: https://t.co/DYEbZQn4uA pic.twitter.com/UaeVS1HC6w 
— Premier League (@premierleague) March 20, 2017 
More: Football Manchester United players to blame for tunnel bust-up, claims Boro boss Steve Agnew 
Kylian Mbappe responds to Man Utd and Arsenal transfer links 
Arjen Robben had a tantrum and his team-mates found it hysterical 
Premier League fixtures are rarely scheduled for a Thursday night, which would appear to suggest the decision has been taken to aid the sides as much as possible in terms of recuperation.
Manchester United fixtures West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sun 9 Apr
Anderlecht (A) – Thu 13 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Anderlecht (H) – Thu 20 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Man City (A) – Thu 27 April
Swansea (A) – Sun 30 April
Mourinho stated last Thursday that his side have many ‘enemies’ and before that that those who decide the fixtures ‘don’t give an S’ about his side.
MORE: Manchester United players to blame for tunnel bust-up, claims Middlesbrough boss Steve Agnew
